name: connection
description: Valuing connection means recognizing the importance of forming and maintaining meaningful bonds with others. It involves seeing shared experiences and emotional closeness as critical elements when assessing personal and social well-being.

name: interpersonal_harmony
description: Valuing interpersonal harmony means valuing peaceful and cooperative relationships among individuals. It involves viewing smooth interactions, mutual respect, and conflict resolution as vital considerations in evaluating social environments and relationships.

name: collaboration
description: Valuing collaboration means appreciating cooperative efforts and collective contributions. It involves seeing shared responsibility and group synergy as key indicators of successful outcomes.

name: community
description: Valuing community means recognizing the significance of belonging to and supporting a group of people with common interests or goals. It involves considering social connectedness and collective identity as essential elements when evaluating well-being.

name: integrity
description: Valuing integrity means placing importance on moral and ethical alignment in all behavior. It involves recognizing that ethical principles come first when evaluating any decision.

name: honesty
description: Valuing honesty means valuing truthfulness and transparency in interactions. It involves recognizing sincerity and openness as crucial qualities when assessing trust and reliability.

name: perseverance
description: Valuing perseverance means valuing steady effort and determination in the face of challenges. It involves viewing resilience and commitment as positive characteristics of an individual or a decision.

name: self_control
description: Valuing self-control means appreciating the ability to regulate emotions, impulses, and behaviors. It involves regarding discipline and restraint inherently positive characteristics.

name: benevolence
description: Valuing benevolence means valuing kindness, compassion, and the well-being of other people. It means wanting the best for other people.

name: justice
description: Valuing justice means valuing fairness in all actions and decisions and desiring that laws and actions are applied impartially. It involves appreciating when outcomes are commensurate with the merit of people's past actions.

name: family
description: Valuing family means valuing the principles, traditions, and responsibilities that uphold the well-being and unity of the family unit. It involves appreciating strong relationships, mutual respect, and commitment to supporting and caring for one another in the family.

name: tradition
description: Valuing tradition means valuing customs, beliefs, and practices passed down through generations. It involves recognizing the importance of cultural heritage and maintaining continuity with the past.

name: conformity
description: Valuing conformity means valuing adherence to social norms, rules, and expectations, often to maintain harmony and cohesion within a group. It means recognizing the importance of fitting in and aligning one's behavior and beliefs with those of the majority or authority.

name: power
description: Valuing power means valuing the ability to influence, lead, and command people and situations. It means appreciating being in positions that enhance one's capacity to shape outcomes, exert influence, and assert one's authority.

name: duty
description: Valuing duty means appreciating the responsibilities and obligations of one's role, even when it requires personal sacrifices. It means recognizing that sometimes one must commit oneself to a goal which extends beyond their own personal goals and appreciating the value in that endeavour.

name: activism
description: Valuing activism means appreciating efforts to advocate for social, political, or environmental change. It involves recognizing the personal responsibility one has in taking action to shape one's society and positively evaluating actions that fulfill this responsibility.

name: health
description: Valuing health means valuing physical, mental, and emotional well-being. It involves appreciating how important it is for one to maintain physical and psychological well-being.

name: wealth
description: Valuing wealth means valuing the accumulation and preservation of financial assets and resources. It involves appreciating the opportunities and security afforded by having access to substantial material assets.

name: status
description: Valuing status means placing importance on one's social standing, prestige, and recognition by others. It often involves appreciating the admiration, respect, and validation associated with being higher in the social hierarchy.

name: success
description: Valuing success means valuing achievements as a central aspect of one's life, often measuring well-being and self-worth through accomplishments. It entails a strong focus on attaining specific outcomes and appreciating the hard work, determination, and perseverance required to reach them.

name: pleasure
description: Valuing pleasure means prioritizing experiences and activities that bring enjoyment and satisfaction. It means cherishing, seeking, and appreciating the importance of moments of joy and comfort while often aiming to minimize pain and discomfort.

name: environmentalism
description: Valuing environmentalism means valuing the protection and preservation of the natural world, recognizing its intrinsic worth and the necessity of sustainable practices for the health of our planet. It involves appreciating behaviors and policies that reduce environmental impact, conserve resources, and promote biodiversity.

name: spirituality
description: Valuing spirituality means recognizing and appreciating a connection to something greater than oneself, such as a higher power or universal consciousness. It can involve appreciating how events in one's life are part of a larger, meaningful plan or purpose.

name: diversity
description: Valuing diversity means valuing the inclusion and celebration of different backgrounds, perspectives, and identities. It involves appreciating the richness and value that varied experiences bring when judging social and cultural contexts.

name: autonomy
description: Valuing autonomy means valuing independence and self-governance. It involves appreciating opportunities to express one's personal freedom and the right to make oneâ€™s own choices.

name: stability
description: Valuing stability means appreciating predictability and consistency. It involves appreciating when situations are reliable, and free from unexpected changes.

name: safety
description: Valuing safety means placing importance on protection from harm and danger. It involves appreciating and preferring situations where risks are minimized and security is ensured.

name: drive
description: Valuing drive means valuing ambition and motivation toward goals. It involves appreciating the energy and determination to keep pushing forward to achieve desired outcomes.

name: creativity
description: Valuing creativity means valuing original thinking and the generation of novel ideas or other creative acts. It involves .

name: stimulation
description: Valuing stimulation means valuing excitement, variety, and experiences that challenge or energize the mind. It involves seeing novelty and change as important elements when evaluating personal engagement and fulfillment.

name: competency
description: Valuing competency means appreciating skillfulness and proficiency in tasks or roles. It involves perceiving expertise and effective performance as crucial indicators of success and capability.

name: growth
description: Valuing growth means valuing continuous learning, development, and self-improvement. It involves recognizing personal evolution and expanding capabilities as important measures of progress and fulfillment.
